intro: Spermacoce auriculata, commonly known as the ear-shaped spurred cucumber, is a tropical flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, spiny fruits that resemble small cucumbers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. The species is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
